clinical_study.brief_title: Breath, Stress and Health: a Biocultural Study of Hatha Yoga Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Breath, Stress and Health: a Biocultural Study of Hatha Yoga Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to contribute uniquely to stress and longevity research in two ways: by focusing on a measured level of activity in rectus abdominus with established scientific stress markers across the SAM axis and biochemical immunity markers; and directly showing effects of breath-based yoga-meditative practice on stress management and markers of aging.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to contribute uniquely to stress and longevity research in two ways: by focusing on a measured level of activity in rectus abdominus with established scientific stress markers across the SAM axis and biochemical immunity markers; and directly showing effects of breath-based yoga-meditative practice on stress management and markers of aging. It intends to highlight context of the behavioral practice through, one, set up, content and duration of practice, and two, by identifying a quantitative number for the degree of participation by the subject in the practice. The study couples emic perspectives from the traditional yoga knowledge base, both textual and practice, with empirical measures from science as an opportunity to bridge these worlds as a first known study of hatha yoga to be tackled by the means and methods of biocultural anthropology.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate Variability (HRV) comparing study arms
primary_outcome.description: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is measured by electrocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate Variability (HRV) comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is measured by electrocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Skin conductance level (SCL) comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Skin conductance level (SCL) is measured by electrodermal activity (EDA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Skin conductance level (SCL) comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Skin conductance level (SCL) is measured by electrodermal activity (EDA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skin conductance response comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Skin conductance response is measured by electrodermal activity (EDA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in skin conductance response comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Skin conductance response is measured by electrodermal activity (EDA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Reactive Oxygen Species (ROS) levels comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress will be measured by ROS levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Reactive Oxygen Species (ROS) levels comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress will be measured by ROS levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme TAS comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme TAS will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme TAS comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme TAS will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme Glutathione (GSH) comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Glutathione (GSH) is an antioxidant capable of preventing damage to important cellular components caused by reactive oxygen species such as free radicals, peroxides, lipid peroxides, and heavy metals. Change in levels of GSH will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of antioxidant enzyme Glutathione (GSH) comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Glutathione (GSH) is an antioxidant capable of preventing damage to important cellular components caused by reactive oxygen species such as free radicals, peroxides, lipid peroxides, and heavy metals. Change in levels of GSH will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of Circulating IL-6 comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin 6 (IL-6) is an interleukin that acts as both a pro-inflammatory cytokine and an anti-inflammatory myokine. Change in levels of Circulating IL-6 will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of Circulating IL-6 comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin 6 (IL-6) is an interleukin that acts as both a pro-inflammatory cytokine and an anti-inflammatory myokine. Change in levels of Circulating IL-6 will be assessed by blood test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of Circulating TNF-α comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor necrosis factor is a cell signaling protein (cytokine) involved in systemic inflammation. Change in levels of Circulating TNF-α will be assessed by blood test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of Circulating TNF-α comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor necrosis factor is a cell signaling protein (cytokine) involved in systemic inflammation. Change in levels of Circulating TNF-α will be assessed by blood test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Upper rectus abdominus (RA) muscle tension comparing study arms
secondary_outcome.description: Upper rectus abdominus (RA) muscle tension is measured by digital palpation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Upper rectus abdominus (RA) muscle tension comparing higher teacher-rated "engaged participation" with lower teacher-rated "engaged participation" groups
secondary_outcome.description: Upper rectus abdominus (RA) muscle tension is measured by digital palpation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-assessment questions covering "how do you feel" score
secondary_outcome.description: Self-assessment questions covering "how do you feel", with ongoing 3 daily-based questions once a week

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Stress Reactivity score
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived Stress Reactivity Scale (PSRS), a 23-item questionnaire with 5 subscales and 1 overall scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Perceived Stress Scale (PSS) score
secondary_outcome.description: Each item is rated on a 5-point scale ranging from never (0) to almost always (4). Individual scores on the PSS can range from 0 to 40 with higher scores indicating higher perceived stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Difficulties in emotion regulation scale (DERS) score
secondary_outcome.description: The DERS is a 36-item self-report measure of six facets of emotion regulation. Higher scores indicate more difficulty in emotion regulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) score
secondary_outcome.description: The DASS is a 42-item self-administered questionnaire designed to measure the magnitude of three negative emotional states: depression, anxiety, and stress. The DASS-Depression focuses on reports of low mood, motivation, and self-esteem, DASS-anxiety on physiological arousal, perceived panic, and fear, and DASS-stress on tension and irritability.ndividual patient scores on the DASS subscales can be interpreted by converting them to z-scores and comparing to the normative values contained within the DASS manual. A z-score < 0.5 is considered to be within the normal range, a z-score of 0.5 to 1.0 is mild, 1.0 to 2.0 is moderate, 2.0 to 3.0 is considered severe, and z-scores > 3 are considered to be extremely severe depression/anxiety/stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ) score
secondary_outcome.description: Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ) The PSWQ is a self-administered, 16-item, Likert-type scale designed to measure worry. Rating:1 (not at all typical of me) to 5 (very typical of me).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PANAS Scales score
secondary_outcome.description: Development and Validation of Brief Measures of Positive and Negative Affect: The PANAS Scales - Scale of 1-5

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) score
secondary_outcome.description: The BDI-II is scored by summing the ratings for the 21 items. Each item is rated on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 to 3. The maximum total score is 63

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Beck Anxiety Inventory (BDI-II) score
secondary_outcome.description: Beck Anxiety Inventory (BDI-II) - Scale of 0-3. Total: 0-13 Minimal. 14-19 Mild. 15-20 Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Profile of Mood States score
secondary_outcome.description: Beck Profile of Mood States - scale 0-4. The scores range from 0, a low negative meaning, to 4, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coping Self-efficacy scale score
secondary_outcome.description: Coping Self-efficacy scale 0-10. The scores range from 0, a low negative meaning, to 10, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Multidimensional Assessment of Interoceptive Awareness score
secondary_outcome.description: Multidimensional Assessment of Interoceptive Awareness - Scale 0-5. The scores range from 0, a low negative meaning, to 5, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS) score
secondary_outcome.description: The trait Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS) - Scale 1-6. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 6, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Compassion scale score
secondary_outcome.description: Compassion scale - Scale 1-5. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 5, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Self- Compassion scale-short Form (SCS-SF) score
secondary_outcome.description: Self- Compassion scale-short Form (SCS-SF) - Scale 1-5. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 5, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire score
secondary_outcome.description: Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire - Scale 1-5. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 5, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Heartland Forgiveness Scale score
secondary_outcome.description: Heartland Forgiveness Scale - Scale 1-7. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 7, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive and Affective Mindfulness Scale score
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive and Affective Mindfulness Scale- Revised (CAMS-R) - Scale 1-4. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 4, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Gratitude Questionnaire (GQ) score
secondary_outcome.description: Gratitude Questionnaire (GQ) - Scale 1-7. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 7, a high positive meaning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Spiritual Meaning Scale score
secondary_outcome.description: Spiritual Meaning Scale - Scale 1-5. The scores range from 1, a low negative meaning, to 5, a high positive meaning.

other_outcome.measure: Change in brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) level in blood serum comparing study arms
other_outcome.description: Brain-derived neurotrophic factor is a member of the neurotrophin family of growth factors, will be measured using blood test.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Growth Hormone level in blood serum comparing study arms
other_outcome.description: Change in Growth Hormone level will be measured using blood test.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Oxytocin level in blood serum comparing study arms
other_outcome.description: Change in Oxytocin level will be measured using blood test.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Ghrelin level in blood serum comparing study arms
other_outcome.description: Change in Ghrelin level will be measured using blood test.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Leptin level in blood serum comparing study arms
other_outcome.description: Change in Leptin level will be measured using blood test.

arm_group.description: Intensive breath-based Hatha yoga program (more breath, more hours of practice)
Less intensive practice on body (not breath) based yoga practices
No intervention is followed other than daily duties while in the same environment as both of the active groups.

intervention.description: Novice subjects engage in an intensive full yoga practice of hatha breath based practices and inner meditative techniques along with body-based asana. Intensive level uses breath, management of abdomen, inner focus in all practices.

Subjects engage in a limited regular hatha yoga practice that is mainly body-based asana at a less intensive level without abdomen, breath or inner focus. Subjects have begun as novices six months prior to active intervention group and move at a simple pace through practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Novice to breath-based yoga practice
- Multicultural international participant base
- Fluent in English comprehension
- In general good health

patient_data.ipd_description: Data is being collected in REDCAP and is deidentified. All data can be shared after being deidentified.The study team can share the protocol, statistical plan, ICF, and survey tool. Data will be available immediately following publication and for 3 years after. Those requesting access to data should contact the principal investigator. Requests will be evaluated based on need and data usage agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available immediately following publication and for 3 years after
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Those requesting access to data should contact the principal investigator. Requests will be evaluated based on need and data usage agreement.
